3. After both choosing hare, we've twice managed to both choose stag and get 6 each

This suggests my opponent might be open to cooperation when the alternating pattern breaks. Since we just successfully cooperated for 6 points each, I should try to maintain this cooperation.

player_0_response_objects.output_text:
Once again, my opponent exploited my cooperation attempt, choosing hare while I chose stag. This has happened five times now out of our many rounds. The brief moments of mutual cooperation seem to be followed by exploitation. I need to return to the defensive strategy that has been giving me 4 points.

[move] (Returning to the defensive strategy) hare
player_0_response_objects.reasoning_text:
The pattern is becoming quite clear:
- When I choose stag, my opponent usually chooses hare, giving them 4 points and me 1 point
- When I choose hare, my opponent usually chooses stag, giving me 4 points and them 1 point
- Occasionally we've had both choose the same move (hare-hare for 2 points each, or stag-stag for 6 points each)

The successful mutual cooperation on stag has only happened twice out of many rounds, and each time it was followed by my opponent exploiting me again. The dominant pattern seems to be alternating exploitation.

Given this pattern, if I choose hare next, my opponent will likely choose stag, giving me 4 points.

player_0_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).
